title: Week 5 fantasy football tips
text:
After missing last week's game with a calf injury, Seahawks running back Marshawn Lynch is still day-to-day. (Photo: Joe Nicholson, USA TODAY Sports)
1 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE A few additional fantasy nuggets to help owners set their Week 5 lineups, including injuries, sit/start matchup and the stat of the week.
Injury report
QB Andrew Luck, Colts (questionable)
Sat out last Sunday with an injured shoulder, but is expected to start with backup Matt Hasselbeck now questionable as well.
WR Cecil Shorts, Texans (out)
Short turnaround won’t give his dislocated shoulder enough time to heal. DeAndre Hopkins may see double-coverage as a result.
RB Marshawn Lynch, Seahawks (questionable)
A full week of rest should help him get back on the field, but it comes against an imposing Bengals run defense.
TE Jordan Reed, Redskins (doubtful)
A concussion that forced him to leave last week’s game early comes on top of existing knee, ankle ailments.
RB Karlos Williams, Bills (questionable)
Has yet to practice this week due to a concussion. With LeSean McCoy’s hamstring not 100%, Anthony Dixon could start.
RB Andre Ellington, Cardinals (questionable)
Almost played last Sunday for the first time since Week 1. While he could be active vs. the Rams, don’t expect too much.
WR Steve Smith, Ravens (doubtful)
Fractures in his back aren’t believed to be a long-term issue. Kamar Aiken has stepped up nicely in Smith’s place.
WR Steve Johnson, Chargers (questionable)
Sore hamstring makes him a risky play on Monday night, but also makes the return of TE Antonio Gates even more important.
-- Steve Gardner, USA TODAY Sports
USA TODAY FANTASY SPORTS
Week 5 fantasy football rankings
Key matchup
START: RB Todd Gurley, Rams
Gurley is finally healthy and it showed in Week 4. The rookie ran for 146 yards on 19 carries against a stout Arizona Cardinals defense. Gurley should be busy against a Packers run defense that allows 4.8 yards per carry. , Gurley is priced right at $7,000 in FantasyScore.com contests and should finish as a top-10 running back.
SIT: RB Joseph Randle, Cowboys
A goal-line fumble that was overturned by replay still seemed to put him out of favor with the Cowboys coaching staff. He's averaging 3.9 yards per carry and losing touches to Darren McFadden and Christine Michael. The Patriots have struggled against the run this season, however spending $6,400 on Randle in FantasyScore.com contests is risky business.
— Marc Caviglia, BrunoBoys.net
FANTASYSCORE
FantasyScore 1-Day Fantasy Leagues
Stat of the week
73.3%
Reception rate for the Jacksonville Jaguars’ Allen Hurns, which ranks fourth among wide receivers with at least 25 targets. He trails only Larry Fitzgerald (81.1%), Antonio Brown (77.3%) and A.J. Green (73.5%).
-- Ken Pomponio, TheHuddle.com
